Date: Wed, 21 Apr 2004 19:51:40 -0700 (PDT)
From: Miles Crawford <mcrawfor@...>
To: parkert@...
Subject: Heritrix questions

I have replaced the ARCWriterProcessor with my own
class that places the documents into a Lucene
index, which is working well.  My questions are
about getting Heritrix to behave the way I would
like.

I'm a little stuck trying to set up a filter - I
would like to process and fetch only those
documents which are text - I can't place
images/zips/docs/pdfs into the Lucene index.

I currently have a filter that excludes
jpg,gif,doc,etc in my crawl profile and a regex in
my archiver class that makes sure only URI's with
the string "text" in their content-type get placed
into the index.  Still, lots of non-text things
get fetched, and I have to add whatever random
extension it is to my exclude filter - kinda ugly.

Can I check the content-type earlier on using some
built-in part of Heritrix?  or will i have to
continue fetching the whole file before i can
definitively choose not to index it?

Also, I would like my crawl scope to be the
following: anything below the path specified in
the seeds or a couple hops(probably 2) otherwise.
I see the OrFilter and FilterScope module, but I
can't seem to organize them such that I get this
scope.

Thanks for any tips you might have!

-miles
